page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: Design & Analysis of Algorithms Binary Search Tree, Tree traversals. Sorting Algorithms : Selection sort, Insertion sort, Heap sort, Merge sort, Quick sort; Shortest path algorithms : Kruskal, Prim’s, Dijkstra, Floyd –Warshall, Bellman-Ford; Graph Traversal: DFS, BFS; Back Tracking, Dynamic Programming. Height Balanced Tree.
page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.

title: Concepts taught in class
text: Data Structures - Trees, Graphs, Heaps, Hash Tables; Sorting Algorithms; Graph Algorithms - Minimum Spanning Tree, Dijkstra, Depth-First Search, Breadth-First Search.; Greedy Algorithms; Dynamic programming;
page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.

title: Student Opinion
text: Very basic course on Algorithms, with no real challenges. Excellent as a kick-start to DSA, but very mundane and basic for someone wanting to get well acquainted to the same. TAs are a little less proficient though when it comes to C programming, but are helpful in clearing your fundamentals about a particular problem, as is Prof. Sourav Mukhopadhyay.
page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.

title: How to Crack the Paper
text: Submit the lab assignments on time and you'll be fine. The lab exams are pretty basic, however one needs to be wary of cases where there is a good chance of the program faltering.
page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.

title: Classroom resources
text: Have a look at the basic questions on every data structure and algorithm on Geeks for Geeks, and practice it before hand.
page: MA29005: Design %26 Analysis Of Algorithms Lab.
